page.title: 09Costessey and Bowthorpe Pits
page.content: There is a rich seam of sand and gravel deposits beneath Costessey and Bowthorpe. Atlas Aggregates, a part of the RMC group, are involved in opencast quarrying of these deposits. The main pit area is to the west of Old Costessey. Another large area is being exploited to the south of the new Bowthorpe development. This is in conjunction with Anglian Water, who intend to move the river when the final reinstatement of the excavated area is carried out. Costessey pits (the area which has been finished with) is used for water skiing. Anglian Water would like to establish an emergency water reserve for the city of Norwich. Another part is being used to dump refuse.
